name: Cheesy Slow-Cooker Creamed Corn
description: Creamed corn, made in the slow cooker, is gussied up with cream cheese, American cheese, and crème fraîche.
recipeIngredient: 12 ears of corn, shucked and cut from the cob, or 2 pounds frozen corn kernels (see note)
3 ounces crème fraîche or sour cream
6 ounces American cheese, grated or finely diced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Combine corn, cream cheese, crème fraîche, milk, cheese, thyme, and bay leaves in a slow cooker. Season lightly with salt and pepper and stir to combine.

Set slow cooker to low setting and cook, stirring every hour or so, until corn is cooked and sauce has thickened slightly, 3 to 4 hours. Discard thyme and bay leaves, season to taste with more salt and pepper as desired, and serve.
